The probability that a randomly chosen patient had A is {{prior}}, and the probability that she had B is {{prior_c}}.
If a patient had A, then the probability that she received a high test result is {{like1}}, and the probability that she received a low test result is {{like1_c}}.
If a patient had B, then the probability that she received a high test result is {{like2}}, and the probability that she received a low test result is {{like2_c}}'
